list.name: Default
list.comment: First commit after reverting back to last nights commit.

list.name: Failed commit: Default
list.comment: A bunch of code formatting to bring broadly in line with Android practice including: * Curly braces around all conditional statements. * Handling of all exceptions with logging. * Acronyms changed to words eg getURL() now getUrl(0. * 100 character line limit. Applied as a profile in the automatic code formatter. Fixed a "Facts" bug that didn't properly check equality between facts and whether a label already existed.

list.name: Failed commit: Default (2)
list.comment: A bunch of code formatting to bring broadly in line with Android practice including: * Curly braces around all conditional statements. * Handling of all exceptions with logging. * Acronyms changed to words eg getURL() now getUrl(0. * 100 character line limit. Applied as a profile in the automatic code formatter. Fixed a "Facts" bug that didn't properly check equality between facts and whether a label already existed.

task.summary: Default task
Initial commit of AndroidStudio project
Initial commit of AndroidStudio project
Initial commit of AndroidStudio project
Test commit
Test commit
Test commit
Test commit
Test commit
Changed project directory name from AndroidStudio to Android
Changed project directory name from AndroidStudio to Android
Removed libs folder for reviewer as gradle takes care of jars now Changed RemoteAPIFetchers min SDK to 9 as google play requires that
Added copyright headers. Commit before code analysis (started some already then decided I should commit first...)

Fixed most static code analysis issues in MyAndroidWdgets, MyGeneralLibrary and RemoteAPIFetchers. Need to change dialog button order to conform to Android 14 (have cancel on left not middle) so committing before making these changes to MyGeneralLibrary.
Changed dialogs to conform to SDK 14 i.e. capitalised button labels and Cancel on left/Confirm on right.

Working through static code analysis: Lint: Fixed all but 16 lint issues. I am comfortable with the remaing 16. Assignment issues: are an AS bug I think. In discussion with Google issue tracker. Declaration Redundancy: mostly unused methods which are there for API purposes or because I know I will use them, Spelling: excluded in inspection profile. XML: from build folder so ignoring.
Also noticed ReviewTagsManager wasn't being hooked into the publishing process. Fixed that.

Some stuff coming up as uncommitted so committing again with same message:
Working through static code analysis: Lint: Fixed all but 16 lint issues. I am comfortable with the remaing 16. Assignment issues: are an AS bug I think. In discussion with Google issue tracker. Declaration Redundancy: mostly unused methods which are there for API purposes or because I know I will use them, Spelling: excluded in inspection profile. XML: from build folder so ignoring.
Also noticed ReviewTagsManager wasn't being hooked into the publishing process. Fixed that.

Some more static code analysis changes, mainly around redundant methods and classes. Changed some method signatures in accordance with the analysis. Small adjustments to some of the fragments where delete confirmation wasn't being used, plus some title changes for alerts. Changed controller to use IntentObjectHolder to register/unregister controllers instead of a hashmap. Added ActivitySearchable to the manifest just to shut the analyzer up even though not finished.
Trying .gitmodules file

Final static code analysis. * Down to 55 "Declaration redundancy"s that I'm happy with leaving as is. *8 "Assignment issues" I think is an AS bug. Google forum people not got back to me on this. * 1 "Properties Files" and 353 "XML" issues are AS generated code so shouldn't even be included.
Moved GridCellLayout to general library.

A bunch of code formatting to bring broadly in line with Android practice including: * Curly braces around all conditional statements. * Handling of all exceptions with logging. * Acronyms changed to words eg getURL() now getUrl(0. * 100 character line limit. Applied as a profile in the automatic code formatter. Fixed a "Facts" bug that didn't properly check equality between facts and whether a label already existed.

A bunch of code formatting to bring broadly in line with Android practice including: * Curly braces around all conditional statements. * Handling of all exceptions with logging. * Acronyms changed to words eg getURL() now getUrl(0. * 100 character line limit. Applied as a profile in the automatic code formatter. Fixed a "Facts" bug that didn't properly check equality between facts and whether a label already existed.

A bunch of code formatting to bring broadly in line with Android practice including: * Curly braces around all conditional statements. * Handling of all exceptions with logging. * Acronyms changed to words eg getURL() now getUrl(0. * 100 character line limit. Applied as a profile in the automatic code formatter. Fixed a "Facts" bug that didn't properly check equality between facts and whether a label already existed.
Changing acronym URL to word Url

Reversing "Changing acronym URL to word Url" commit as github doesn't seem to update the actual filename so AS loses track of it. Weird that one can't refactor a class name without everything screwing up in VCS.

Changed the formatting options to ensure constructors remain together.
Changed ActionType enum in DialogTwoButton to hold a text label too so buttons can ask for default labels for bound actions.
ReviewTreePublisher takes ReviewNode not review as argument to publish. Changed getDescendents() on ReviewNode to flatten() as essentially that's what it was.
Simplified Administrator

Decided to add some Javadoc after all to help clarify what is going on.
Good for me too as I've fixed some (potential) bugs by simplifying some stuff because I've had to think about it again....
I'm not convinced that reviews need internal nodes. Doing a commit before I try and refactor them out.
Templated RCollectionReview to take anything that has a getId() method that returns an RDId. No need for separate RCollectionReviewNode.
Simplified and generalised the Controllers to better mirror the Review inheritance tree

Simplified the Review, ReviewNode, ReviewEditable set up. Still too much overlap though so think it can be simplified further.
There's a bug in Location fragment somewhere where it crashes if it doesn't immediately find a location. need to fix.
Changed isPublished() logic for nodes to look at whole tree.
Some javadoc stuff

Some javadoc stuff and simplification of ViewHolder classes.
ViewHolderBasic now holds a list of all updateable views by viewId so now removed view initialisation that extracted relevant views when inflating.

Some javadoc stuff and simplification of Review class hierarchy.
ReviewTreeEditable is now both an ReviewEditable and ReviewNodeExpandable. Now simply a wrapper for a ReviewNodeExpandable with a ReviewEditable as root so that neither is exposed.
Similarly for ReviewTree vis-a-vis ReviewTree and ReviewNode.

Some javadoc stuff and simplification of Review class hierarchy.
ReviewTreeEditable is now both an ReviewEditable and ReviewNodeExpandable. Now simply a wrapper for a ReviewNodeExpandable with a ReviewEditable as root so that neither is exposed.
Similarly for ReviewTree. Now implements ReviewNode instead of Review.

Some javadoc stuff and adjustment to the Controller hierarch..
Changed name of Controller to ControllerReviewTreeEditable and made it inherit from ControllerReviewEditable for editable duties. Internally holds a ControllerReviewNodeExpandable for tree-related duties. Adjusted Fragments and Dialogs accordingly.

Some javadoc stuff and changed FragmentReviewGridAddEditDone.
Added default banner button and grid cell click behaviour to show previously specified dialogs for adding and editing. Simplified a bunch of Fragments because of it.

Some javadoc stuff and changed Review hierarchy.
Got rid of ReviewNull, ReviewUser. ReviewUserEditable now gets wrapped in a ReviewTree when published. ReviewNull no longer needed.
Finished javadoc stuff.

Changed OptionsReviewData to also represent general UI interaction when adding and editing data e.g. knows about ad and editing dialogs.
Name changed to ConfigReviewDataUI.
Made FragmentReviewGridAddEdit more generic off of the back of it. Similarly DialogAddReviewdataFragment.
Knock on effects to Dialogs and Fragments.

Refactoring FragmentReviewAddEdit and Add and Edit dialogs to become more flexible through the use of an Input Handler object.
At the moment there is a separate FragmentReview and DialogAddReviewData for each GVType. Trying to change this by splitting out the specific GVType handling logic into InputHandlerReviewData objects that know how to deal with their own GVType so that FragmentReview and Add/Edit dialogs can be abstracted into just one class. Aim is that each of these then just fowards user input to the appropriate handler.
Working for GVTag.
More work on refactoring fragments and dialogs to be more abstract and modular. Adjusted GVData to help with this. Worked on Children stuff.

More work on refactoring fragments and dialogs to be more abstract and modular.
Gone through all dialogs and fragments. Much more abstract and general now. More work still to be done though.

More work on refactoring fragments and dialogs to be more abstract and modular.
Added DialogHolder, DialogHolderBasic, UIDialog and UIDialogManager to aid the separation between dialogs and data. DHFact and DHChild use a potential pattern that coan be futher abstracted.

More work on refactoring fragments and dialogs to be more abstract and modular.
Tags, Children, Facts, Comments, use a unified AddEdit framework for dialogs, Images uses the Edit part of the framework. Locations and URLs instigate activities for editing and unique dialogs for adding so don't fit into this set up. Added ConfigAddEditActivity to define appropriate classes for aforementioned data that use this framework. Removed old versions of DialogTagAddFragment, DialogTagEditFragment etc. as now defined using one line in ConfigAddEditActivity.

More work on refactoring fragments and dialogs to be more abstract and modular.
Tags, Children, Facts, Comments, use a unified AddEdit framework for dialogs, Images uses the Edit part of the framework. Locations and URLs instigate activities for editing and unique dialogs for adding so don't fit into this set up. Added ConfigAddEditActivity to define appropriate classes for aforementioned data that use this framework. Removed old versions of DialogTagAddFragment, DialogTagEditFragment etc. as now defined using one line in ConfigAddEditActivity.

Some added constraints for review children and images plus dialog listener callbacks for adding and editing.
Added InputHandlerChildren to check if child subject not already present. Ditto for bitmaps in GVImageList.
Dialog callbacks added to allow boolean 2-way communication between dialogs and commissioning fragments for success flags. Before dialogs could message fragments but not vice versa so dialogs would update e.g. titles on Add press regardless of whether data was added successfully. Makes things a touch more messy and separated compared to the previous OnActivityResult() messaging which worked for both dialogs and commissioned activites e.g. for Locations/URLs. Now OnActivityResult is for Location/URLs and everything else uses dialog listeners. A bit messy.

Wrapped add and edit dialogs/activities in ReviewDataUI interface.
Want review data fragments to be indifferent to whether they are launching dialogs or activities to add/edit review data. Adjusted Configs accordingly.
Some documentation. Also made ConfigReviewDataUI more robust by making Config only ask for GVType and get it to initialise adders, editors and display configs itself.
Finished documenting recent changes
Some static code analysis which led to some code cleanup.
Some renaming of classes
Some renaming of variables
Changed to Gradle project structure
Changed all module structures and project structure to conform with Gradle conventions. Simplified build scripts accordingly by removing 'SourceSets' designations.
Changed all module structures and project structure to conform with Gradle conventions. Simplified build scripts accordingly by removing 'SourceSets' designations.
Moved over to using the Gradle wrapper system so checking in gradle/wrapper directory and gradle batch scripts.
Reverting back to last nights commit to undo all the screw ups with GitHub I did this morning trying to change module names.
First commit after reverting back to last nights commit.

Some javadoc stuff and simplification of ViewHolder classes.
ViewHolderBasic now holds a list of all updateable views by viewId so now removed view initialisation that extracted relevant views when inflating.

Some javadoc stuff and simplification of Review class hierarchy.
ReviewTreeEditable is now both an ReviewEditable and ReviewNodeExpandable. Now simply a wrapper for a ReviewNodeExpandable with a ReviewEditable as root so that neither is exposed.
Similarly for ReviewTree vis-a-vis ReviewTree and ReviewNode.

ReviewTreeEditable is now both an ReviewEditable and ReviewNodeExpandable. Now simply a wrapper for a ReviewNodeExpandable with a ReviewEditable as root so that neither is exposed.
Similarly for ReviewTree. Now implements ReviewNode instead of Review.

Some javadoc stuff and adjustment to the Controller hierarch..

Some javadoc stuff and changed FragmentReviewGridAddEditDone.

Some javadoc stuff and changed Review hierarchy.
Got rid of ReviewNull, ReviewUser. ReviewUserEditable now gets wrapped in a ReviewTree when published. ReviewNull no longer needed.
Finished javadoc stuff.

Changed OptionsReviewData to also represent general UI interaction when adding and editing data e.g. knows about ad and editing dialogs.

Made FragmentReviewGridAddEdit more generic off of the back of it. Similarly DialogAddReviewdataFragment.
Knock on effects to Dialogs and Fragments.

Refactoring FragmentReviewAddEdit and Add and Edit dialogs to become more flexible through the use of an Input Handler object.
At the moment there is a separate FragmentReview and DialogAddReviewData for each GVType. Trying to change this by splitting out the specific GVType handling logic into InputHandlerReviewData objects that know how to deal with their own GVType so that FragmentReview and Add/Edit dialogs can be abstracted into just one class. Aim is that each of these then just fowards user input to the appropriate handler.

Locations and URLs instigate activities for editing and unique dialogs for adding so don't fit into this set up. Added ConfigAddEditActivity to define appropriate classes for aforementioned data that use this framework. Before dialogs could message fragments but not vice versa so dialogs would update e.g. titles on Add press regardless of whether data was added successfully. Makes things a touch more messy and separated compared to the previous OnActivityResult() messaging which worked for both dialogs and commissioned activites e.g. for Locations/URLs. Now OnActivityResult is for Location/URLs and everything else uses dialog listeners. A bit messy.

Want review data fragments to be indifferent to whether they are launching dialogs or activities to add/edit review data. Adjusted Configs accordingly.
Some documentation. Also made ConfigReviewDataUI more robust by making Config only ask for GVType and get it to initialise adders, editors and display configs itself.
Finished documenting recent changes

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: First commit after reverting back to last nights commit.
